intro: Hydnophytum cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hydnophytum, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Hydnophytum cuneatum is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
